definition: lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
variant of 餘|余[yu2], remainder

sentences.english: This is the knot, the representative of the national anthem, every year more than the meaning of.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國結，代表吉祥如意，年年有餘的意思。

sentences.english: Fish is always part of the dinner because it represents abundance.
sentences.chinese: 魚總是晚餐必不可少的，因爲魚象徵着年年有餘。

definition: ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
Happy New Year
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
auspicious/propitious/good fortune
(myth.) peaches of immortality, kept by Xi Wangmu/fresh or confectionery peaches offered as a birthday gift
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
to praise/well done, bravo!
